How to Install alltray on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • alltray

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install alltray on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing alltray on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall alltray in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install alltray, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install alltray Using apt

To install alltray in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install alltray using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install alltray

The installation of alltray might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install alltray Using apt-get

To install alltray using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install alltray.

sudo apt-get -y install alltray

Install alltray Using Synaptic

To install alltray using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install alltray on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for alltray. This will display the alltray package in the package window, now to install alltray, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the alltray package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of alltray.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install alltray Using aptitude

To install alltray on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of alltray.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install alltray using the command aptitude install alltray.

sudo aptitude -y install alltray

How to Upgrade alltray on debian

If you want to upgrade the alltray package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade alltray using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade alltray to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade alltray.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade alltray sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade alltray

Upgrade alltray using Aptitude

To upgrade alltray using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade alltray.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade alltray

Upgrade alltray using Synaptic

To upgrade alltray using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for alltray, now right-click alltray, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade alltray just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall alltray on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall alltray from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just alltray, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove alltray

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of alltray

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of alltray you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge alltray

Remove alltray using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall alltray using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for alltray, right-click the alltray package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall alltray click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install alltray on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade alltray using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
